title: HTML id Attribute
gp1: The HTML id attribute is used to specify a unique id for an HTML element.
gp2: You cannot have more than one element with the same id in an HTML document.
gp3: The id attribute specifies a unique id for an HTML element. The value of the id attribute must be unique within the HTML document.
gp4: The id attribute is used to point to a specific style declaration in a style sheet. It is also used by JavaScript to access and manipulate the element with the specific id.
gp5: The syntax for id is: write a hash character (#), followed by an id name. Then, define the CSS properties within curly braces {}.

wp2: HTML bookmarks are used to allow readers to jump to specific parts of a webpage.
wp3: Bookmarks can be useful if your page is very long.
wp4: To use a bookmark, you must first create it, and then add a link to it.
wp5: Then, when the link is clicked, the page will scroll to the location with the bookmark.
